alert.note: Alert for Tioga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 2:46AM EST until December 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New York, including the following counties, Broome, Chemung, Cortland, Tioga and Tompkins and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen, as rainfall rates approach a half inch per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Binghamton, Cortland, Johnson City, Endicott, Waverly, Owego, Marathon, Greater Binghamton Airport, Vestal, Barton, Rush, Danby, Caroline, Virgil, Dryden, Nanticoke, Litchfield, Berkshire, Richford and Solon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
